title: Sam Smith's Writing's On The Wall makes history as first Bond number one
text:
Sam Smith's Writing's On The Wall makes history as first Bond number one Sam Smith's Writing's On The Wall makes history as first Bond number one 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Sam Smith can call himself 001 as he scored the first-ever number one James Bond theme with Writing’s On The Wall. 
The Spectre track soared straight into the top spot with 70,000 combined sales and streams, finishing 13,000 ahead of closest competitor, Justin Bieber’s What Do You Mean? The name’s Smith, Sam Smith (Jonathan Short/Invision) 
Sam told OfficialCharts.com: “It was such an honour to be asked to write and record Writing’s On The Wall and it’s incredible that it’s become the first number one Bond theme song. 
“It’s been an unforgettable experience working with Barbara (Broccoli) and Sam (Mendes) to become part of this British legacy. 
“I couldn’t have done this without my fans – this is a special moment I’ll never forget.” 
Writing’s On The Wall is Sam’s fifth number one single. Adele performing Skyfall at the 2013 Oscars (Chris Pizzello/AP) 
It is also the first James Bond theme song recorded by a British male solo artist since 1965. 
Only two other 007 signature tracks have got close to the number one spot – Adele’s Skyfall and Duran Duran’s A View To Kill both peaked at number two. 
Sam will unveil the full music video at an apt 00:07 on Monday October 5, to coincide with Global James Bond Day. 
The rest of the top five sees R City and Adam Levine stay at three with Locked Away, Sigala’s former number one Easy Love slip from two to four, and The Weeknd’s Can’t Feel My Face hold firm at five. Howard and Guy Lawrence of Disclosure (Jonathan Short/Invision 
In the album charts, siblings Howard and Guy Lawrence, best known as Disclosure, bagged their second number one after the success of their 2013 debut Settle. 
They said: “Can’t believe it! So happy and thanks so much to all the people for supporting our music. It means the world and we can’t wait to hopefully see you all at a show soon!” 
The album, Caracal, features collaborations with Sam Smith, The Weeknd, Lorde and Miguel, among others. Jess Glynne (Omar Vega/AP) 
New Order’s 10th album, Music Complete, was a new entry in second place and marked the band’s 10th top 10 placing. Share article 
Last week’s number one, David Gilmour’s Rattle That Lock, slid to third place, Scottish synth band Chvrches entered at four with Every Open Eye and Jess Glynne dropped to five. Promoted Stories
